titleStmt.title: David Barnett to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2205

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
DAVID BARNETT,
Attorney and Counsellor at Law,
No. 377 FULTON STREET,
(OPPOSITE THE NEW COURT HOUSE,)
BROOKLYN, N. Y.
NOTARY PUBLIC AND COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS
FOR
NEW JERSEY AND PENNSYLVANIA,
Maine,
New Hampshire,
Vermont,
Massachusetts,
Rhode Island,
Connecticut,
Virginia,
Maryland,
Tennessee,
Ohio,
Michigan,
Indiana,
Illinois,
Wisconsin,
District of Columbia.
OFFICE HOURS, 8 A. M. TO 5 P. M.
RESIDENCE, 100 RYERSON STREET.
Law Office of
DAVID BARNETT,
397 Fulton St.
Brooklyn, N. Y. Sept 27th 1865.
Sir:
I take the liberty of addressing you to ascertain if I can be appointed a Commission to take the proof or acknowl=edgment of Deeds &c for your State to reside in this City.

I am a Commissioner by appoint=ment for several States, and by virtue of my office as Notary Public for this State I am by the laws of a number of other States with the exception of yours, authorized to take the acknowledgment of Deeds &c for those States.

I am a member of the bar of this City and can furnish any evidence of my standing &c, I am familiar with the
duties of the office. I should like to be appointed a Commissioner very much, and shall be indebted to you for an answer.

Respy Your obt Servt.
David Barnett

Hon Thos. E. Bramlette
Governor of the State of Kentucky
Frankfort
Ky.

Comr Deeds
New York
Brooklyn
Comd
David Barnett
2d Oct/65
